slideInfo.title: What is the historical context of the map?

pButton.popInfo: Republics were not ruled by a hereditary ruler such as those in a kingdom or duchy. Venice had an elected leader know as a doge [pronounced "dough-j"], while Florence was ruled by a group of wealthy families, including the Medici. A substantial portion of Italy was ruled directly by the Roman Catholic pope, and these were known as the Papal States.
The Duchy of Savoy, Mantua, Sienna and Sicily were all independent states within the geographic region of Italy, though they were politically dominated by the five major Italian states.

What is the significance of the date 1454? Historians often create maps to show the results of a treaty that has ended a period of conflict. This map shows the political situation after the Peace of Lodi in 1454, signed by the five major Italian city states. This treaty ushered in a relatively peaceful period of about 40 years during which a balance of power was maintained among these states. Due to a decrease in conflict, trade and commerce expanded which benefitted merchants, bankers, and the rulers of the Italian city states.
